Reviews.Title: “Good if you are on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: jarrodh
Reviews.Content: I must admit, the first impressions were not great, The Building is a bit uninviting and dim. Very nice helpful staff though, we had a small room with a window looking out to the service duct, As bad as this sound the room reminded be of a toilet block, simply because of the green tile walls. It was very clean however. It had a shower over toilet arrangement but the drainage was not flash, it would overflow if you showered too long. The bed was very small for a double and was firm because it was simply a mattress on a timber 'bench' frame Clean mattress tho. The Aircon worked well but it was a 'in-window' unit and as the window was in a service duct it was full of other air conditioning systems, one of which dripped alot and landed on the top of our air-con, the result was a rather repetitive loud dripping noise that went all night.. It did take a while to get used to it :/ Also sometimes there was a long wait for the lift, on the last day around 8am we waited for 3 full lifts to go passed the floor and ended up getting frustrated and giving up and taking the stairs (6 floors with all our luggage) The wifi worked OK but was very unstable. Overall it was budget range accommodation and if I was to return to Hong Kong id spend the extra $30-$40 a night on something mid-range. Be sure to walk 2 blocks north and take a left to get a Froyo from Crumbs :)

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: Emilyjoong
Reviews.Content: If u r on a budget this is the right place. It is very small but remember it is hong kong. It is absolutely clean!!!! Great location & friendly staff! Highly recommended and definitely will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Room small /location strategic”
Reviews.Author: Tramychan
Reviews.Content: Last may'12 go with my family,after review from a lot of comment from Internet,we consider book this hotel.cause is under our budget .first of all,when we step into d hotel,the guesthouse is what we aspect,hong kong style hdb,the lift very small only cam fix 5-6person only,but if got luggage will little bit tight la.room very small,d guesthouse provide us are 2 double-decker bed la,but there got free wifi,room after put luggage no more place to stand la.but d location of guesthouse very nearby to tong choi street, fa yuen street, walking distance to temple street around 20min la.guesthouse also provide selling like ocean park ticket,Disneyland ticket,ferry transfer to Macau....guesthouse also provide some info for meal,so we success eat a lot of delicious local food la.overall, recommend for those lower budget traveling in hong kong la.

Reviews.Title: “very small room but well run”
Reviews.Author: Frannk982
Reviews.Content: I had one of those broom cupboard single rooms, en suite so small i had to shower over the toilet, feet hung over the end of the bed by about 12 inches, price 360 HKD. OK for one night. Good location near Mongkok station.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Elsa H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at Oi Suen for four nights. On the second day of my visit I came down with the flu and was absolutely miserable. The owner was so sweet and gentle. She walked with me to the doctor's office down the block, holding her umbrella over me. I am so grateful that I ended up at a place where I could get help in this sort of situation. That aside, fantastic location, great price, clean rooms, and lovely air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Half Bad/Half Good Experience with this Guesthouse”
Reviews.Author: emz_hatake
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time visiting Hong Kong and I've stayed at the Sincere House before so I prefer guesthouses in this location. I booked through them weeks ahead specifying a room with a window which we agreed to reserve and pay for more. The day we arrived, we were told the room is not ready yet so we leave our things and set out to get some food. We were told to come back at 1pm and so we did. Then they were giving us this cramped "triple room" with no windows. Of course we refused, since we agreed on a room with a window. The lady in charge was getting mad at me for their mistake which was so wrong. She was telling me check in time was 2pm when the email they sent specifically states that check in time is 1pm, even the guy manning the booth told us to come back at 1pm. She even told me to just go to some other guest house which was SO RUDE but we've already paid when we arrived in the morning. This information would have been useful if she told me she couldn't accommodate us when we made reservations. If we weren't so tired from the journey, I wouldn't mind finding a room at Chungking Mansion. I was so mad and tired at the same time. I didn't expect 5 star accommodation from a guesthouse but I didn't expect them to be that rude either. Long story short, they moved us to a different room on a different floor - room with a window. Then we transferred to their guesthouse after 2 nights. They were nice after that like nothing happened. Maybe this could have been a good review if they weren't very rude at the start. As they say, first impressions last. I noticed that they had a lot of Thai guests and maybe that's their niche. So, just be warned. Because of that, I would not recommend this hostel and I wouldn't come back. There are plenty of guesthouses in this building who wouldn't go ballistic on you because they messed up the reservations. I recommend the Dragon Hostel on the 7th floor. They were just fully booked at the time of my booking.

Reviews.Title: “Home-y Place!”
Reviews.Author: Glenne S
Reviews.Content: It's my first time in Hongkong and I somewhat got culture - shocked. My mom explained to me that in Hongkong, every space is expensive-- meaning, the bigger space you have, the more you will pay. And since we're on a budget travel, when we saw this and the reviews about Oi Suen Guest House, we didn't hesitate to get it. When we get there, we really enjoyed it. Why? a. Home-y. It truly feels like home. I feel comfortable with the room considering the fact that I'm claustrophobic. Everything you need for you to enjoy your stay, they have. Towels, soap gel (body gel), shampoo (hair gel), pillows, water, coffee, very fast internet connection (700kbps, my bro told me), thing is you have to bring your own laptop xDD I guess it's in the atmosphere created within the hostel :) b. Convenient!! Not only it is accessible to places like Ladies' Market, Fa Yuen Street Market but also to Langham Place and Argyle Center! My mom and I could shop with ease and we could easily eat!!! c. REALLY CHEAP AND AFFORDABLE! But of course, since it's really cheap and affordable, do not expect anything out of the ordinary. d. Super adorable staff!! Rainbow is really nice and would assist you nicely with what you need, she also speaks english and understands the language. On the other hand, Sam (the guy -- her niece) can speak only little english but understands some of it. Well, at least he's trying unlike others who are rude. There you have it! I hope you'd choose this place when you visit HK!

Reviews.Title: “Safe, good location”
Reviews.Author: louis_Apr12
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stay in a HK hostel, it was good experience. Ellen and everyone is helpful and willing to serve. At this price point, I will rate Safety as first, Location as 2nd. Though rooms are small at this category, I stay in Single room ... all the utilities work (aircon, heater, TV, fan, light). Also, Oi Suen more than make up and scored excellently well in these 2 areas (Safety, Location). There are no touts below at the building at both exits. Location is good with many streets (Ladies, Sports good, food, etc) and good food (dim sum) and massage easily accessible. They also offer discounted tickets to various popular locations and can get from them directly. With friendly service, I will look forward to staying back again the next time. A good budget hostel choice.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg City, Russia
Reviews.Title: “Good price for excelent quality”
Reviews.Author: ArtuKo
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to spend several days in Hong Kong. Good location, clean and comfortable rooms. 5-star hospitallity. Rainbow - the hostess, was extremelly helpful. Do not hesitate to choose this guesthouse in Mongkok area.

Reviews.Title: “Price small but Quality Big”
Reviews.Author: Narin P
Reviews.Content: really a nice location i stay single room , it clean ,safe ,service computer. Rainbow is so cute. and her English is very well. i have a good time at here. , i would book them again because of this. i'm quite satisfied with the quality of service and the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hostel”
Reviews.Author: Grace082
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, great location. It was a bit of a struggle to check-in since the guy did not know how to speak English, thou pleasant and accommodating. Rainbow was very easy to deal with and had a very charming personality. Good discounted tickets to the Macao ferry. No window but the ceilings were high so it didnt feel claustrophobic at all. Bathroom was really tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and is conveniently located in the night life of Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: katele
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for more than 2 weeks, had no problems with their service, cleanliness and security, it was just perfect! Highly reccomend it to everyone if they want to enjoy the night life of Hong Kong at an incredible cheap rate!

Reviews.Title: “Great - But not the Private Room for One Person”
Reviews.Author: yachingu
Reviews.Content: If you are claustrophic and traveling alone - do not stay in the private room. This was my first time staying in a hostel in HK and even though I was aware that the room was going to be small I was not prepared for the prison like conditions of the private room for a single person. The total size of the single private room is about the size of a closet. The bed is encased by three tiled walls and when you slip off the edge of the bed you are literally at the bathroom. I barely could close the door to take a shower b/c there was just no space! The noise in the room is also very creepy. The sounds get flitered through the exhaust pipes and by the time it reaches your room it has an echoey effect. I could not sleep and was very grateful someone happened to have been hammering at the same time and I was able to get upgraded to a double occupancy room. The double occupancy rooms were much better (I stayed in a room with windows) in terms of natural sounds (Mong Kong is busy so be prepared for city noises) and a bit more space. The bathroom is still very tight so if you're not that close with your traveling partner you'll need to schedule shower times as you will have to step out of the bathroom naked. There is no space and everything in there will get wet. Pros: - staff very friendly, however as noted by others the brother and mother have very limited English - clean - free wifi (hard to find in the city) and free local calls - discounted tickets to local attractions - location is pretty central with food and 7-11 close by Be aware: - If I havent' said it enough times - SOLO travelers do not stay in that private room - I stayed on two separate occasions (once by myself and the 2nd time with a friend) with a one day break. They charged me to leave my luggage behind. I was a bit surprised as I was coming back to continue my stay and it was 1 piece for 1 day. - Check out time is stated at 12pm on the bookings but they will try to get you out by 11am. I stayed until 12pm.

Reviews.Title: “Clean--but small with NO WINDOW!”
Reviews.Author: amershon
Reviews.Content: I'm claustrophobic. so you can imagine that I felt a little like my room was a prison cell. I managed to get by, using earplugs for the loud music during the night. The elevator broke down while I was there (8th floor), but I discovered another one on the other side of the block. If you're into tiled walls and no floor space but you're a budget, the Oi Suen is for you. Be aware that the desk person may not speak any English. In it's favor, my room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “great value budget hostel.”
Reviews.Author: slam91
Reviews.Content: we stayed with oi suen from 15-26 dec and i had booked quite late but luckily the owner rainbow was able to allocate rooms to us even during such peak periods. i'd like to personally thank her for keeping by her word and trusting us. we hadn't begun our stay or even paid any deposit and needed a huge favour from rainbow. we needed a place to store 4 huge luggages while we were away on a 5 day tour and she was very friendly in assisting us. We barely had any contact with her on those 5 days and arrived in hk at almost 11pm and rainbow actually waited all night for us to arrive. oi suen is located in sincere house and having stayed with dragon hostel and ah shan before, i'd highly rank oi suen next to dragon hostel. i was deeply appalled by the service and manner of the owners at ah shan, where its all about the money. oi suen is situated smack bang in mongkok close to the MTR and near by all great places for shopping or dining. rooms are small but honestly if you've stayed with other hostels, im sure you're aware that size is minimal in hk. therefore toilets and showers will also be combined, having said that if you can't live in such a small area of space, i'd suggest you not consider budget stays. you get what you pay for and hk hotels are quite expensive. rooms and toilets are clean as they are tidied and swept everyday. rooms are equipped with fan, aircon, lcd tv, free wifi, basic toiletries, phones with free local calls. they offer ticket deals for tourists and van services to the airport which we asked for since there were 4 of us and had way too many luggages for a taxi. rainbow the owner of the guest house went out of her way many times in accommodating us and she was nice and friendly, funny to joke with too. overall their service is beyond excellent and it was certainly a pleasure to stay with oi suen. p.s. the old lady is rainbow's mum and with limited english it may be hard for non-chinese guests to communicate with her please she is really nice as well and always busy on her feet.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time to Oi Suen”
Reviews.Author: leoguy25
Reviews.Content: again, nice location with many good foods just around the corner (wantan noodle, my favourite!)

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travellers but do not expect great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ymtan
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Really near Lady street and it's really convienient to just walk back up to rest after all the shopping - cheap accomodation- ideal for backpackers Cons: - the rooms are really small. beside the bed, there are barely any walking space and if you are carrying large baggages, chances are you will not be able to open them up fully. - The lady that was around was rude and could not speak any english at all. expect zero to little customer service from this lady who is around practically 24/7 during my period of stay. - they do sell discount tickets to attractions but despite informing them that we need the peak tram tickets the next day(they ran out on the day we first asked and was told they will have it the next day), they did not stock up for us so we ended up buying our tickets from the peak tram station instead. - Not recommended for friends as they are no room for you to hang/place your towers/clothes while you shower and the only way is to place your dry clothes outside the toilet. Spare yourself the awkward moments when you have to open the door to get your dry stuffs.

Reviews.Title: “OiSuen - with good service”
Reviews.Author: heroes19
Reviews.Content: Overall, staying at Oisuen is the good choice for a budget traveling and especially for backpacker who are not really need the luxury requirement. The location is good as in Mongkok, you can see a lot of shops around your hostel after you go down from the building. Convenience, lady street is just near to the hostel. Is extremely convenient for girls shopping...hehe. ^.^ The manager called Rainbow, is really helpful. She will give you some guide for the traveling information. Also, they are selling some tickets for the attraction. They accept returning tickets if you do not use it. Room is clean, almost everyday she will come for room service. To me, is really satisfied. Regards, Heroes19 http://newzealand-paradise.blogspot.com/

Reviews.Title: “the best place to stay at hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Jerbyson B
Reviews.Content: The best experience we had at hongkong, the location is fine , As a first timer we already expect to get lost.. and that would be the best part when travelling, it is not so hard to find the guesthouse you could ask help for directions..." not hard to find".... My partner and I stayed for 5 days at Oisuen and Ellen help us out for almost everything once we got there... shes so very kind , friendly and accommodating... I would really recommend this guesthouse to everyone if they visit hongkong... planning to come back soon.... thanks a lot oisuen and ellen....= )

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: Muggsley
Reviews.Content: Heres an honest review...the guesthouse is in an high rise block of run down flats. Poor location unless you want to shop all day but if you want to see hong kong then you will always have to get the metro to hong kong island as this place is in Kowloon. Wherever you stay you will have to get the metro to places but being near a metro stop on hong kong island would be much better. Here you are surrounded by rows of shops which are manic 24-7. The worst thing about this place is the room...awful. About 2 metres squared, no windows and the 'bathroom' is in fact a toilet which has had a shower head attached above it-fine if you like sitting on the toilet to shower. You literally cannot move at all in these rooms. Yes, miss ellen is friendly and will help you with whatever you need-a bonus is she sells cheap tickets to attractions. However the other two staff are anything but friendly. One night i asked if i could nip on the computer for one minute to which I got a stern no before she turned back to the computer game she plays all night-a lad let me use his laptop and I was literally on it for 90 seconds,not what you call friendly service. The plus point of this guesthouse is that there is wifi in the rooms and it's right near a metro stop. You won't want to spend any time in the room or in the area close to the guesthouse so I would recommend staying somewhere near a metro,perhaps further out of town, and get a better place. We hear Y youth hostel is good but it was full so we couldn't escape our prison cell! Would not stay here if you paid me, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A good, budget hostel.”
Reviews.Author: CreamPuffs
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong is well known for being a crowded place suffering from a lack of space, the hostels areexactly the small. It was perhaps the smallest room that I've been in in a hostel! But despite it being small, it was well equipped even providing small provisions of soap, shampoo and if I didn't recall wrongly, toothpaste! Not bad for a budget hostel. The location is fabulous, just a short walk away from Mongkok MRT. however, if you can't stand the smell of smelly tofu, there is a smelly tofu stall right next to the entrance of the hostel! So you might have to put with the smell. The hosts are friendly and the rooms are cleaned everyday. No complains about cleanliness over here. There is wifi and if you're claustrophobic remember to request for a room with a window!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with Great location”
Reviews.Author: highfever88
Reviews.Content: At a very good location, within a minute or two walk to the Mong Kok MTR station. The street markets; Ladies Market, Sportwears Market etc are all within short walking distance. Lots of eateries just at doorsteps, with a very nice dim sum restaurant downstairs. The smell from the 'rotten' tofu downstairs on the street can be unbearable. It's an acquired taste. We could somehow smelled the faint odour up on the 8th floor, but it was not so strong that it disturbed our rest. It could be due to us not shutting the windows tightly before going out, or even from our own clothing, for hanging around the said stall downstairs - cos they have very nice curried fish balls. A must try. However, after the first night, we didn't really smell it again. True to HK standard, the room is very small, and the bathroom is shockingly tiny! It's not noisy considering how close it is to the markets, and things kinda worked well, except for one morning when the flush on the toilet didn't work, and this was due to some kind of water shortage according to the staff. They provide tickets to attractions such as Disney, Ocean Park, Peak Tram etc at discounted price, which is very convenient. However, make sure you check the ticket as the older woman staff actually gave us the children's ticket to Ocean Park! Thank God we checked. It was a unintentional mistake as she couldn't read. Just be sure to check yourself. When you are paying such good price for the room, do not have too high of an expectation. It's just a nice room to sleep in, at a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Had a charming adventurous stay”
Reviews.Author: N8kind
Reviews.Content: I booked this guesthouse for 3 nights, just half day before arrival. The first two nights I had to stay in a guesthouse on another floor (they all seem to belong together) which was a little surprise and frustration concerning the room, but it was okay for me as the host Ellen was veeery likeable and considerative. The last night I got a beautiful room in Oi Suen, what over all, made it a charming stay. Besides, the building is safe for storing valuables. There are many cameras and you can trust the stuff.

Reviews.Title: “would have been good if i had been more realistic”
Reviews.Author: sianz
Reviews.Content: i was not realistic. I was expecting hotel standard at hostel prices. As long as your expectations are realistic for the price you pay, this place is really one of the best. It's relatively clean, albeit old. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location,budget,nice host,clean room,definitely worth staying :)”
Reviews.Author: Phooiyeee
Reviews.Content: You will be greeted with a smile by the friendly host-Ms Rainbow once u arrived.All the staffs are very helpful to assist u on everything you need (where to eat/where to shop).The room is very clean. Strategically located at busiest place of hk -Mongkok,near to Ladies street,Temple street,Langham place(H&M!).Only one minute walk to the MTR station.By just walking in Mongkok,you can do alot of shopping:) Oisuen guesthouse provide free wifi service which is definitely a plus point:)They do have a public computer if you need to go online. Even though the toilet is quite small and the room is just enough, the host told me you may request for a bigger toilet/bigger room upon booking confirmation. I will definitely come back to oisuen again during my next visit to HK:)

Reviews.Title: “Oi Suen is a budget friendly guesthouse! :)”
Reviews.Author: RyJenSantos
Reviews.Content: Even though we got lost finding Oi Suen, we were contented with the room. We're 3 people and chose the room w/o window and it was ok. Since we don't have a window, we don't know the time and if it's day or night. There's a TV, a small bathroom and the free WI-FI connection was so fast! Thankfully, Rainbow, didn't cancelled our confirmed room even if we're late for 2 hours.:) Rainbow was very warm, accommodating and helpful. Too bad, we hadn't had a chance to take a picture with her in our last day coz she was sick.:( She also sells tickets to the sightseeing places around HK. The place was near MTR, Ladies Market, authentic Chinese restaurants and bus stops!:) It's also near 2 branches of 7-11, Argyle Center, Langham Place (where H&M is located), KFC and McDo. I hope we'll be back here within this year to shop some more...:)

Reviews.Title: “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Tong
Reviews.Content: It was a memorable and pleasure trip to HK. The guesthouse is very clean, reasonably priced and most of all it is super convenient. The MRT station is just few minutes away, Ladies Street is just few walks away, Temple Street is reachable on foot and most of all most of the famous food and eateries is surrounding Oi Suen Guesthouse. Isn't it a Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon? Rainbow, the guest house manager is a very down to earth pretty girl, who provide lots of information about places of interest in HK and food tips and always with a smile on her face. Sam, Uncle Victor, Ah Lin & Cindy is very helpful too. If you guys are looking for something that has everything you wanted in HK, Oi Suen Guesthouse is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “There were 5 of us, and it was during peak season! Family trip...”
Reviews.Author: eDaLiNe
Reviews.Content: We, a family of five, stayed there for two night on 24th and 25th of April, and because Easter falls on 24th April, it was considered peak season and thus higher rates for the rooms. They have a single room for five occupancy, is the family room for HKD 600/ night, one month earlier I have send my confirmation and personal details to Ms Ellen to booked it (no deposit is required), until two weeks before my arrival, I emailed Ms Ellen asking her about the confirmation but Ms Ellen claims that they did not received my booking, thus in the end because all rooms were almost fully booked, I have to take two rooms, one double room and one triple room for a total of HKD 800/night . HKD 320/night for the double room and HKD 480/night for the triple room. Generally people in Hong Kong are quite rude, and inhospitable. However, Ms Ellen, the householder of Oi Suen Guest House turns out to be quite the opposite, the exception one. Putting aside an oversight on my booking incident, she’s been very friendly, accommodating and certainly resourceful pertaining to traveling around HK. Oi Suen Guesthouse is located in a building name Sincere House, almost all floors of this building has one guest house, but I think Oi Suen is the best out of the rest in term of cleanliness and value for money based on my previous research. At first glance, the building looks old and moldy outside, on the contrary, the room is clean. It is no doubt that the room is really small and a bit ‘crampy‘, is certainly not advisable for people with huge physique, you can barely turn in the toilet. You will also find that there is no space for you to open up your luggage bag but to put it in a upright position. However, is well worth the money because of its location. It is strategically located near Ladies Market, Gold Fish Market, Langham Place and Mong Kok MRT station is just three minutes walking distant. Bute, Fife, Nelson, Portland, Shanghai, Fa Yuen, Tong Choi, Sai Yeung Choi Streets are all easily accessible, is walking distant to great shopping and dining. The room is equipped with fan and also air-con, LCD television, Wi-Fi connectivity, hot and cold water to drink, simple toiletries, clean sheets, comfy beds and you can also get laundry service for a minimal fee. They also have many TVB channels and programs which serves as an entertainment for us during late night, and because I am a big fan of TVBs, thumbs up for that ;) Plus they do room cleaning daily. We did not encounter any problems during our sleep, it was not noisy outside nor can we hear our neighbors. Overall it provides good rest and quality sleep. Is well worth the money. Oi Suen Guest House also offer discounted tickets for Disney Land, Ocean Park, Tram, Sky Terrace, Madame Tussauds, Big Bus Tour and taxi to airport which is a thumbs up. But still bumped about having to pay extra for two rooms instead of the family room which I have booked.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: mker2010
Reviews.Content: I got the tiny tiny room without window and with an even smaller bathroom. Not all rooms are the same size though. For me it was ok because I was only there for 2 nights. I would double check what room you would get. However, the room was clean, in a local area and the staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fine. Nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: hope42morrow
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly fine guesthouse, but just fine. Nothing special. The staff was very friendly and ready to answer any questions I had. I didn't feel like the place was secure though. I never found the outer door closed and my room had a regular old (easily copyable) key and no chain or anything as a back up for when I was alone in there. The elevators are just annoying (even more backlogged than the other HK places I've been). The location is fun, in the middle of both day and night markets (the Ladies Market is just across the street at night, the Fish, Flower, and Bird Markets are only a few blocks away during the day). But you can get closer to the Kowloon nightlife and other attractions. The room was small, even by the Hong Kong standards I've experienced elsewhere. I barely fit my bed (at 5'6'', I'm not THAT tall) and, although I've seen some small bathrooms, this one wins. You must be stradling the toilet to take a shower and I left the door open to turn around and wash my hands in the sink. There is better in HK for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful host and staff”
Reviews.Author: Purplehaze8604
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my kids and other family members. Rainbow, the host, was really nice and so was her staff. They were very helpful and accomodating. Will definitely come back to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Value for money and Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: swlpll
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. Room was reasonable sized and value for money , given the great location. Manager Rainbow is the absolute star to making our stay a pleasant experience. Many great recommendations, including a trip to the nearby " food centre" where we had the best porridge ever. She also went out of her way to help us get roasted pigeon when she knew I wanted to try it very badly but couldnt find it. We found in her , a friend indeed ( hugs to you Rainbow ) We feedback some recommendations on improvements and they immeidately took our feedback seriously and made amends as we suggested. Overall, no regrets but we left with great appreciation for the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Good. clean rooms, nice service, and good place to start branching out.”
Reviews.Author: SinisdeX
Reviews.Content: Being my first time to the far east, i was pleasantly surprised with my stay at this hostel. It is centrally located, so you find your way around quite easily. The MTR stations are quite close by, and if you need any help in locating a place or are looking for a particular service the staff are willing to provide you with the necessary information.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay”
Reviews.Author: kwok4303
Reviews.Content: From the outlook, nothing impress me though! But once you step in the particular lot, you see two different world! Definitely it is not a 3-5 stars hotel but i would say it is a 4 stars guesthouse! Location wise is fantastic as just opposite to the Ladies street and less than a minute walk to the nearby MRT. The residence manager (owner) by the name Ms Rainbow is very much helpful to fulfill your needs. The room i stay slightly smaller i guess, but it is fine because it is really clean which we concern the most! All the basic ammenities like laundry, tea making facilities, internet service, ticketing, etc. you can find it here. Enjoy our stay and definitely a nice guesthouse to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, helpful staff, great place and location for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Smark1976
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for this guest house. Extremely helpful staff. If you're not familiar with Hong Kong then this is your place! Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. Great location for the budget minded traveller. And their attraction ticketing service is a huge plus. A+ in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and efficient service. Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: feelohp
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by Oi Suen Guesthouse. I immediately felt like one of the family as I walked in. Uncle Victor was very kind and hospitable. Located in the busiest part of Mong Kok, Oi Suen has convenient access to transport, shops, eateries and malls. Special mention to Rainbow who was charmingly helpful in giving me directions to latest fashion places. Rooms were very clean and tidy, and the cleaners were great and efficient in changing towels. Facilities are sufficient, as expected of Hong Kong accommodation. Overall, great value, great location, I would definitely go there again =]

Reviews.Title: “if you are looking for a budget hostel, go for this.”
Reviews.Author: metalcandybox
Reviews.Content: If you are comparing apple to apple, by comparing Oi Suen with the rest of the guesthouse in Sincere House or ChungKing Mansion, do go for Oi Suen. Oi Suen host is friendly, nice and helpful. The rooms are clean, with white clean sheets and clean toilet. Apart from air con, they do have ceiling fan too. This is the first time i am staying in a budget hostel and the concerns I had before arriving in the guesthouse disappeared once i see the clean room. Location is fabulous. Worth the money if you are on a budget.

HotelInfo.Address: R811-812, 8/F Sincere House, No.83 Argyle Street, Mongkok, Kowloon, Hong Kong, China
